title: The Ten Commandments
shortSummary: Exodus 20 records God giving the Ten Commandments to the Israelites through Moses, establishing foundational moral and spiritual laws for His covenant people. This chapter reveals God's holiness, justice, and mercy, and sets the standard for righteous living and worship.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus and the giving of the Law at Mount Sinai

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The mediator between God and Israel who receives and delivers God's commandments to the people.

keyCharacters.name: The Children of Israel
keyCharacters.description: The covenant people of God who receive the Ten Commandments as instructions for holy living.

definitions.definition: A carved or sculpted idol or representation used in worship, forbidden by God as it leads to idolatry.
The seventh day of the week set apart by God for rest and holy observance, commemorating His rest after creation.
A description of God’s zeal to protect His exclusive relationship with His people from idolatry and unfaithfulness.
To strongly desire something that belongs to another, which the commandment forbids as it leads to sin.

outline.heading: Introduction and First Commandments
outline.description: God declares Himself as the LORD who delivered Israel and commands exclusive worship, forbidding other gods and idols, emphasizing His justice and mercy.

outline.heading: Prohibition of Misusing God's Name
outline.description: God commands reverence for His name, forbidding its misuse, highlighting the holiness and respect due to Him.

outline.heading: The Sabbath Commandment
outline.description: God institutes the Sabbath as a holy day of rest, reflecting His creation pattern and calling Israel to cease from labor.

outline.heading: Commands on Social Relationships
outline.description: God outlines ethical duties including honoring parents, and prohibitions against murder, adultery, theft, false witness, and coveting, establishing moral order.

outline.heading: The People's Fear and Moses' Mediation
outline.description: The Israelites react with fear to God's powerful revelation; Moses reassures them and approaches God on their behalf.

outline.heading: Instructions on Worship and Altars
outline.description: God gives further instructions on worship practices, forbidding idols of silver and gold and prescribing proper altar construction to maintain holiness.

application: Prioritize God alone in your worship and avoid any form of idolatry in your life.
Honor the Sabbath by setting aside regular time for rest and spiritual renewal in obedience to God’s design.
Respect and honor your parents as a foundation for a long and blessed life.
Guard your speech to avoid taking God's name in vain, reflecting reverence and holiness in daily life.

keyVerses.text: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
keyVerses.significance: This verse establishes the foundational principle of exclusive devotion to the one true God.

keyVerses.text: Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.
keyVerses.significance: This command calls believers to honor God’s provision of rest and to recognize His lordship over time.

keyVerses.text: Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
keyVerses.significance: This command links family respect with God’s blessing and longevity, underscoring its importance.

keyVerses.text: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's wife, nor his manservant, nor his maidservant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing that is thy neighbour's.
keyVerses.significance: This verse addresses the heart’s desires, warning against envy that leads to sin and disrupts community harmony.
